intro: Korthalsella dacrydii, commonly known as the yellow korthalsella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has simple, opposite leaves and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
